title: Fish with tomatoes, potatoes, and onions
ingredients: 5 large potatoes, cut into bite-size pieces
sea salt and freshly ground black pepper

steps.detail: Heat the oil in a large shallow heavy-based pan, add the potatoes, and season with sea salt and freshly ground black pepper. Cook over medium heat, stirring frequently, for 10–15 minutes or until beginning to turn golden brown. Lower the heat, then stir in the garlic and parsley and cook for a few seconds before adding the tomatoes.

Cook for a few minutes, until the tomatoes begin to split, then raise the heat, add the wine, and allow to bubble for a couple of minutes while the alcohol evaporates. Decrease the heat to low, add the fish and the anchovies, cover, and cook for 10–15 minutes, or until the fish is cooked. Transfer to a large shallow serving dish and serve with a crisp dressed salad and some crusty bread.

decription: Doro wat is a traditional Ethiopian meal. It is often served with other foods including braised beef and various vegetables. It is made up of many components and takes a long time to properly cook. This article explains how to create a traditional doro wat, serving up to six people when served with a few other vegetables on the side.
